abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Basic
            Education Capacity (BEC) Project for Indonesia is to support
            Government of Indonesia (GOI) achievement of Millennium
            Development Goal (MDG) and EFA goals through good governance
            in education, improving the delivery of decentralized basic
            education services by local governments and schools in
            selected program areas, and by extension in other locations.
            This project restructuring paper seeks the approval of the
            Country Director to make the following changes to the
            Republic of Indonesia's Basic Education Capacity Trust
            Fund (BEC-TF), Grant and accompanying amendments to the
            project's legal documents. The changes have occurred as
            a result of (i) repercussions to the overall program due to
            the Ministry of Finance (MoF) 18 month delay with BEC grant
            release; (ii) the Netherlands Government decision to reduce
            their contribution to the grant by 8,700,000 due to a
            reduction in their development assistance to Indonesia; and,
            (iii) the extension of time necessary to enable the
            achievement of program results and disbursement according to
            planning and budgeting cycles. There are two major changes:
            extension to December 31, 2012 and cost- neutral budget
            re-allocations between categories. No change is to project
            development objectives and intermediate outcome indicators.
